A sailor delivers a powerful blow to Indy's face, sending his grip and skittering across the deck. Indy grabs a cro sailors who attack him from the sides. INDY sees that the Cross is about to be swept overboard. He SNATCHES UP the Cross only to be knocked down to the d He struggles to his feet, managing to avoid the giant fue deck around him. dialogues.text: (softly; reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Venice, Italy." Then, INDY stuffs his mail into his coat pockets, goes to open and STEPS OUT INTO THE GARDEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY escapes through the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY walks briskly toward the street; smiling, erUoying h arrives at the curb, a LONG BLACK PACKARD SEDAN pulls up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Jonesl THREE MEN step out of the sedan. Everything about them be The First Man steps behind Indy. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY is ushered into a large Art Deco apartment and left museum-quality artifacts are displayed around the room. I opportunity to examine them. After a moment, WALTER DONOVAN enters from across the roo brief time that the door is open, we HEAR a COCKTAIL PART next room: VOICES and SOFT PIANO MUSIC. DONOVAN strides across the room toward INDY. Although in Donovan has the broad shoulders and trim physique of a mu Dressed in a tuxedo, he exudes both confidence and power. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust your trip down was comfortable, Doctor Jones. My men didn't alarm you, I hope. He shakes hands with INDY. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Donovan. Walter Donovan. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are Mr. Donovan. Your contributions to the museum over the years have been extremely generous. Some of the pieces in your collection here are very impressive. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, like yourself, Doctor Jones, I have a passion for antiquities. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a look over here. This might interest you.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DONOVAN goes to a table where an object is wrapped in clo the cloth revealing a flat STONE TABLETВ—about two feet s letters and symbols. INDY looks impressed. He puts on his glasses to make a cl INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's sandstone. Christian symbol. Early Latin text. Mid- Twelfth Century, I should think. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was our assessment as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did this come from? DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My engineers unearthed it in the mountain region north of Ankara while excavating for copper. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you translate the inscription? Translating the inscription is no easy matter, even for s as INDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stumbling through it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... who drinks the water I shall give him, says the Lord, will have a spring inside him welling up for eternal life. Let them bring me to your holy mountain in the place where you dwell. Donovan pours champagne into several fluted glasses as In INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the desert and through the mountain to the Canyon of the Crescent Moon, to the Temple where the cup thatВ—" Suddenly INDY stops and looks up at DONOVAN with a startl INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Where the cup that holds the blood of Jesus Christ resides forever. "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reverently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Holy Grail, Doctor Jones. The chalice used by Christ during the Last Supper. The cup that caught His blood at the Crucifixion and was entrusted to Joseph of Arimathaea. INDY rubs his chin with a dubious expression as he takes DONOVAN now offers him. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Arthur Legend. I've heard this bedtime story before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eternal life, Doctor Jones! The gift of youth to whoever drinks from the Grail. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, now that's a bedtime story I'd like to wake up to! INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old man's dream. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every man's dream. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including your father's, I believe. INDY stiffens slightly at the mention of his father, nods INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grail lore is his hobby. He's a teacher of Medieval Literature. The one the students hope they don't get. The door opens and MRS. DONOVAN steps into the room. She' woman in an expensive evening gown. MRS. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, you're neglecting our guests. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be along in a moment, dear. He leans over and kisses her cheek. MRS. DONOVAN sighs to to the party. INDY, meanwhile, has turned his attention b obviously hooked by its archaeological promise. He moiste champagne and rubs it over the tablet. DONOVAN steps up n

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to resist, isn't it? The Holy Grail's final resting place described in detail! INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good is it? This Grail Tablet speaks of deserts and mountains and canyons. Pretty vague. Where do you start looking? Maybe if the Tablet were intact, you'd have something to go on. But the entire top portion is missing. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the same, an attempt to recover the Grail is currently underway. INDY has to shake his head at DONOVAN's apparent lack of DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you another "bedtime story, " Doctor Jones. After the Grail was entrusted to Joseph of Arimathaea, it disappeared and was lost for a thousand years before it was found again by three Knights of the First Crusade. Three brothers, to be exact. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard this one as well. Two of these brothers walked out of the desert one hundred and fifty years after having found the Grail and began the long journey back to France. But only one of them made it. And before dying of extreme old age, he supposedly imparted his tale to aВ—to a Franciscan friar, I think. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not "supposedly," Doctor Jones. DONOVAN produces an ANCIENT LEATHER-BOUND VOLUME with ver pages. INDY views the manuscript with considerable intere

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the manuscript in which the friar chronicled the Knight's story... it doesn't reveal on location of the Grail, I'm afraid... but the Knight promised that two "markers" that had been left behind would. (indicates the Tablet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Tablet is one of those "markers." It proves the Knight's story is true. But as you pointed outВ—it's incomplete. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, the second "marker" is entombed with the Knight's dead brother. Our project leader believes that tomb to be located within the city of Venice, Italy. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can now see, Doctor Jones, we're about to complete a great quest that began almost two thousand years ago. We're only one step away. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's usually when the ground falls out from underneath your feet. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could be more right than you know. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've hit a snag. our project leader has vanished. Along with all his research. Uh, we received a cable from his colleague, Doctor Schneider, who has no idea of his whereabouts or what's become of him. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to pick up the trail where he left off. Find the man and you will find the Grail.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the wrong Jones, Mister Donovan. Why don't you try my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already have. Your father is the man who's disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FORD COUPE speeds down the tree-lined street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ford coupe pulls up in front of the house. INDY climb hurries up the walkway. BRODY is a step behind. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father and I have been friends since time began. I've watched you grow up, Indy. And I've watched the two of you grow apart. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen you this concerned about him before. They climb the porch and notice that the front door is aj quick look of concern as they enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY approaches the half-open front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? (to BRODY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an academic A bookworm. He's not a field mans He pushes open the door. He enters the house and calls ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY opens one half of the curtains dividing the hall fro We see the place has been ransacked.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRODY sees INDY's face and opens the other half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk into the room. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What has the old fool got himself into now? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But whatever it is, he's in over his head! BRODY picks up some mail from Henry's cluttered desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?               BRODY It's today's mail. And it's been

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: opened. INDY turns and sees the pile of torn papers and envelopes him. INDY Mail! That's it, Marcus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He immediately empties his pockets of his own mail taken his college office and finds the envelope with the Venice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he tears it open)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venice, Italy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? INDY uncovers a small book. It looks like a JOURNAL or DIARY. Indy flips through it: Page after page of handwritten notes and drawings. BRODY glances at it with great curiosity. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dad's Grail Diary. Every clue he ever followed. Every discovery he made. A complete record of his search for the Holy Grail. This is his whole life. Why would he have sent this to me?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But someone must want it pretty badly. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe, Marcus? As INDY asks the question, he turns to a PAINTING on the Christ on the Cross, his blood being captured in a golden A SECOND PAINTING on the wall shows Eleventh Century Crus to their deaths over a high cliff. One Crusader, however, because he holds the Grail in his hands. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe the Grail actually exists? BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The search for the Cup of Christ is the search for the divine in all of us. BRODY sees that INDY is unsatisfied by this response. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you want facts, Indy, I have none to give you. At my age, I'm prepared to take a few things on faith. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Donovan, Marcus. Tell him I'll take that ticket to Venice now. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell him we'll take two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIMO is parked beside a PRIVATE AIRLINER that bears the CORPORATE LOGO. BRODY peers inside to DONOVAN and INDY. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, what's going to happen when we get to Venice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Doctor Schneider will be there to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schneider? DONOVAN (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I maintain an apartment in Venice, at your disposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well. That's good. Thank you. BRODY and DONOVAN shake hands. INDY steps from the back s He turns back to Donovan and shakes his hand. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Jones. Good luck. Be very careful. Don't trust anvbody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY opens the Grail Diary and thoughtfully turns through at one page and glances at a PENCIL SKETCH of what might window. Below the sketch is a SERIES OF NUMBERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERIMPOSED over a MAP that traces a course from New Yor Italy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY and BRODY disembark from the Water Bus onto the Boat Gondoliers steer their boats in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Venice... BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Uh, how will we recognize this Doctor Schneider when we see him? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe he'll know us.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly a WOMAN comes up to him. Attractive features. Bl that are bright and intelligent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it was youВ— She looks at him with an appraising expression that is br

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—you have your father's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY is instantly attracted to her. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my mother's ears. But the rest belongs to you. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the best parts have already been spoken for. INDY grins, enjoying the repartee. The WOMAN turns to BRO ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus Brody? BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. The Woman, DR. ELSA SCHNEIDER, extends her hand to BRODY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (introducing herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Elsa Schneider. INDY's grin fades. BRODY registers a look of surprise. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... how do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY, BRODY and ELSA walk along the narrow canal, lined w either side.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last time I saw your father we were in the library. He was very close to tracking down the Knight's Tomb. I've never seen him so excited. He was as giddy as a schoolboy. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Attila the Professor? He was never giddy, even when he was a schoolboy! INDY can't take his eyes off ELSA. Perhaps he's feeling a himself right now. As they cross over a bridge to the opp Indy steals a flower from a street vendor. He holds it ou INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FrauleinВ—will you permit me? ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I usually don't. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I usually don't either. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, I permit you. INDY gives her the flower. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would make me very happy. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm already sadВ—by tomorrow it will have faded. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow I'll steal you another. BRODY (cutting in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to interrupt youВ—but the reason we're hereВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I have something to show you. She hands a slip of paper to INDY.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left your father working in the library. He sent me to the map section to fetch an ancient plan of the city. When I got back to his tableВ—he'd goneВ—with all his papersВ—except for that scrap which I found near his chair. INDY extends the scrap of paper to BRODY. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman numerals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELSA leads INDY and BRODY into the large piazza. People w tables in front of a large building. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is the library. They have arrived at the front steps of the library. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't look much like a library. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a converted church. ELSA leads the way inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY, BRODY and ELSA enter, their heels CLICKING across t We notice, along with INDY and BRODY, that the library co glass windows. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this case it's the literal truth. We're on holy ground. These columns over here... She indicates FOUR HUGE MARBLE COLUMNS that go from floor ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... were brought back as spoils of war after the sacking of Byzantium during the Crusades.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INDY glances at the Columns, then notices a Stained-Glass Knight of the Crusades. Indy lingers for a moment in fron ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now please excuse me. The library's closing in a few moments. I'll arrange for us to stay a little longer. The minute ELSA is out of earshot. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MarcusВ—I've seen this window before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? INDY whips out the Grail Diary and opens it to the sketch airplane. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. In Dad's Diary. You see? BRODY glances at the Diary, then at the windowВ—noticing numerals in question have been worked into the window's d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Indy. The Roman numerals! INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad was onto something here! BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now we know the source of the numbers, but we still don't know what they mean. INDY and BRODY now see ELSA approaching. Indy quickly tuc into his pocket. INDY (explaining to Brody)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad sent me this Diary for a reason. Until we find out why, I suggest we keep it to ourselves. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find something? INDY doesn't reply. He's looking in five directions at on across the walls and ceilingsВ—charged with the thrill of

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRODY (to ELSA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes. Three, seven and tent That window seems to be the source of the Roman numerals. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, I must be blind INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad wasn't looking for a book about the Knight's Tomb... he was looking for the Tomb itself ELSA wears a blank expression. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? The Tomb is somewhere in the library! You said yourself it used to be a church! Look. INDY's eyes travel up one of the four huge marble columns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three. INDY looks again to the stained-glass window. He points. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three! INDY has discovered that each Column is numbered with a R hurries away toward Column VII. All BRODY and ELSA can do up with him. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven. He points again to the stained-glass window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven... Ten. He looks down to the scrap of paper in his hands. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ten. Now where's the ten? Look around for the ten. INDY walks past aisles of book-lined shelves. He stops, t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three, seven and ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs a spiral staircase leading up to a LOFT and loo ELSA. The floor beneath their feet is an elaborate tile d "X"В—visible only from this higher angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten. (wryly; to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "X" marks the spot. INDY rushes down the staircase and goes to the CENTER TIL sides of the X intersect. He blows dust away from the til but cannot. INDY rushes past BRODY to a cordon held in place by a bra the stained-glass window. INDY raises the brass stand and timing his actions, hits Librarian stamps a book. The Librarian regards the stampe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY continues to pound at the tile as the Librarian resu puzzled by the SOUND ECHOING through the library. Finally INDY breaks the tile. As he bends to remove the p TWO-FOOT SQUARE HOLE IS REVEALED. Cold air and a wet, rancid smell escape from the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't disappoint, Doctor Jones. You're a great deal like your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except he's lost, and I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower me down. INDY is impressed with Elsa's spirit, and cooperates agre the hands and lowering her into the hole. When her feet f below, Indy releases his grip on her and slips the Grail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look after this for me, will you? Then INDY disappears into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY jumps down a steep step. He reaches back to help ELS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. INDY and ELSA glance around. This is really a horrid plac foul smelling. Elsa turns. She removes a cigarette lighte four-leaf clover design. INDY and ELSA inspect markings carved onto the walls. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pagan symbols. Fourth or Fifth Century. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Six hundred years before the Crusades. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Christians would have dug their own passages and burial chambers centuries later. INDY takes the lighter from her and lights their way down INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. If there's a Knight of the First Crusade entombed down here, that's where we'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE MEN carrying guns make their way down the spiral st unsuspecting BRODY. One of the Men, KAZIM, raises his gun hard on Brody's head. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh. . . KAZIM gestures with his gun toward the now-unconscious BR men take Brody's hands and drag him into one of the book-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECOMPOSING CORPSES rest in niches carved into the stone skeletal remains with rotting linen stretched across blac INDY holds the lighter up as he and ELSA inspect symbols

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ELSA spots a symbol cut into the wall that she doesn't re away some cobwebs: ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this one? INDY only has to give it a quick glance to know. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ark of the Covenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty sure. INDY holds the lighter up and he and ELSA enter another d

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE CATACOMBS
dialogues.text: INDY steps to the wall and runs his hand over the stone. away to reveal the ROMAN NUMERAL "X."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out. ELSA now holds the lighter as INDY rams his shoulder into collapses on impact and Indy falls through into another r

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ROOM
dialogues.text: as INDY falls through the hole in the wall onto rocks sur green, slimy liquid. More skeletons surround him, resting ELSA holds the lighter as she peers in at him through the INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petroleum. I could sink a well down here and retire. INDY reaches up and tears a piece of cloth from one of th breaks apart and falls into the oil-slick water. INDY uses the scrap of cloth and a bone to fashion a crud dips into the oily water. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the lighter.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE CATACOMBS
dialogues.text: Using the cloth-wrapped bone torch to guide their way, IN upon a NARROW PASSAGEWAY. The water is knee-deep and TEEM RATS. Thousands of them Crawling on one another's backs. Squirming. Thrashing in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, rats... ELSA gasps as the rats scamper between her legs. INDY moves forward through the rat-infested water as ELSA in horror. Suddenly he slips into a hole. Recovering his to Elsa. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come onl She gasps once again, terrified. INDY lifts her and carri forward.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATACOMBS
dialogues.text: KAZIM and his men step to the opening Indy made earlier a flashlights through to the rat-infested water.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE CATACOMBS
dialogues.text: More rat-infested water as ELSA, now walking again, follo another passageway lined with skulls and bones. INDY reaches for a wall to steady himself and inadvertent bone comes loose in his hand as rats scurry about and lea directions. He takes a moment to compose himself, then steps across t side. He steps into the water, then reaches up to help El

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BURIAL CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The chamber is flooded with black, briny water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. . . In the center of the chamber, jutting up above the water, "island altar" on which SEVERAL ANCIENT COFFINS rest. The altar.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INDY and ELSA begin to inspect the ornately carved COFFIN antiquity that they are. These are big oak caskets held t etched brass. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be one of these... ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the artistry of these carvings and the scrollwork. One coffin is elevated above the others. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's this one. Together they begin to push on the lidВ—STRAINING and GRO slides away and BANGS against the stone platform.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE COFFIN
dialogues.text: lie the DECOMPOSED REMAINS of a KNIGHT IN ARMOR. INDY and in...Elsa gasps. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is itl we found it! LookВ— the engraving on the Shield. It's the same as on the Grail Tablets The Shield is the Second Marker! INDY unfolds a piece of paper and holds it over the shiel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rubbing Dad made of the Grail Tablet. The missing portion of the rubbing is completed by the sh ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: He never would have made it past the rats!  He hates rats!  He's scared to death of them!

dialogues.text: as it lights a match. PULL BACK TO REVEAL KAZIM dropping the lighted match into water.

The rats literally wash over themВ—like a rodent tidal wa escape a:

dialogues.text: The rats are beginning to force their way inside, swimmin and climbing on ELSA, who squirms and screams in terror. INDY pops back up through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: The perfect picture postcardВ—St. Mark's Square and the G Cafe customers are startled to see INDY and ELSA climb ou and smelly. Indy looks around at the postcard-perfect set

dialogues.text: (wryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Venicel Indy's delight, however, is short-lived since KAZIM and T AGENTS are running towards them with drawn guns. He grabs ELSA by the hand and the two of them run down th INTO A MOTORBOAT.

dialogues.text: INDY fires up the engine and pulls away from the dock... Turkish Agent JUMPS in with him. ELSA grabs the wheel and begins to steer the boat while I punches.

INDY grapples with the Turkish Agent. As Indy grips his a the Agent's hand. It FIRES. As INDY fights with the Turk, he becomes aware of the Spe and two enormous Freighters ahead of him, joined together INDY, having gained the advantage, leans on top of the Tu

dialogues.text: Are you crazy?! You don't go between them! ELSA can barely hear INDY over the noise of the motor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go between them? Are you crazy?! INDY finally delivers the punch that sends the Turkish Ag Turning, Indy sees that ELSA has committed the speedboat the two Freighters, now being pushed even closer together

dialogues.text: I said go around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said go between them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said don't go between them! It's purely academic at this point since the hulls of the up on either side of them like cavern walls.

dialogues.text: One Enemy Speedboat chases INDY between the two Freighter containing KAZIM veers off and goes around.

dialogues.text: spin their boat around in a sharp half-circle to see KAZI racing toward them. He stands in the moving boat, FIRING INDY and ELSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: matches Indy's move for move.
