dialogues.text: The two boats race across the water nearly side-by-side. MACHINE GUN from Kazim's boat SPLINTERS the wood of Indy' finally the rear of the boat CATCHES ON FIRE. The machine gun runs out of ammunition. KAZIM puts it dow of the wheel from one of the Turkish Agents in the boat w As Indy's boat drifts toward the GIANT, TURNING PROPELLER ANOTHER STEAMER, Kazim's boat draws up alongside and hits steps into Kazim's boat. He knocks one of the Turkish Age turns his attention to KAZIM. The two men trade punches a helplessly in the churning water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!! INDY kicks KAZIM in the face, knocking him into the water into the boat, now being SUCKED THROUGH THE CHURNING WATE Steamer's giant propeller blades. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you trying to kill us? KAZIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're looking for the Holy Grail. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father was looking for the Holy Grail. Did you kill him too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? TalkВ—or you're dead. Damn it, tell me! Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't let go, Doctor Jones, we'll both die.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll die. KAZIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My soul is prepared. How's yours? By now half the boat has been chopped up into matchwood a getting closer. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your last chance. KAZIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Doctor Jones. It's yours! The wind of the blades is on their necks. INDY grabs KAZI jumps... into the motorboat, driven by ELSA, which gets a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! Where's my father KAZIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you let me go, I will tell you where he is. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? KAZIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Kazim. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why were you trying to kill me? KAZIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secret of the Grail has been safe for a thousand years. And for all that time the Brotherhood of the Cruciform Sword has been prepared to do anything to keep it safe. KAZIM pulls back his shirt to reveal a birthmark... or is is, it's a cruciform sword; a Christian cross which taper a broadsword. KAZIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get off at this jetty. The boat is close to the edge of the canal. INDY gives EL bring the boat in. KAZIM steps ashore.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KAZIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask yourself, why do you seek the Cup of Christ? Is it for His glory, or for yours? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come for the Cup of Christ. I came to find my father. KAZIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, God be with you in your quest. Your father is being held in the Castle of Brunwald on the Austrian-German border. KAZIM walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE WATER-SOAKED PAPER IMPRESSION: The rubbing t the shield of the Grail Knight. BRODY is giving it careful study while he dabs the lump o with an ice pack. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better, now I've seen this. It's the name of a city. "Alexandretta?" Hmmm... INDY, wearing a bathrobe, leans over to study the impress INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knights of the First Crusade laid siege to the city of Alexandretta for over a year. The entire city was destroyed. BRODY lowers the ice pack from his head and looks at INDY INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The present city of Iskenderun is built on its ruins. MarcusВ— you remember what the Grail Tablet said. "Across the desert and through the mountain to the Canyon of the Crescent Moon." (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But where exactly?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father would know. Your father did know. Look. He made a map. BRODY picks up the Grail Diary. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must have pieced it together from clues scattered through the whole history of the Grail Quest. A map with no names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It covers two pages of the Diary. BRODY's finger moves ac BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, he knew there was a city with an oasis due east. Here. He knew the course turned south through the desert to a river, and the river led into the mountains. Here. Straight to the canyon. He knew everything except where to begin, the name of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solemnly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexandretta. Now we know. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Now we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, get hold of Sallah. Tell him to meet you in Iskenderun. INDY closes the Grail Diary and puts it into the pocket o BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going after Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY opens the door. His bedroom has been ransacked...the floor, the drawers turned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY approaches another door (Elsa's bedroom) and knocks. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa? He goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and finds that Elsa's bedroom is in a similar ransack room is empty. He is worried for her, knocks and calls out: INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa? He steps into the room and knocks upon the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa? He opens the bathroom door, peering inside. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa is standing before a mirror, wearing a silk bathrobe INDY enters. He retreats back into her bedroom as she rea record player sitting on a ledge above the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELSA joins INDY, waiting in the ransacked room. she looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were they looking for? She looks to INDY, who pulls the Grail Diary from his poc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grail Diary. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had it? You didn't trust me! She looks hurt and beautiful. She comes closer to him. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you. She's awfully hard to resist. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least I let you tag along. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Give them a flower and they'll follow you anywhere. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off. You're not mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You like the way I do things. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lucky I don't do things the same way. You'd still be standing at the Venice pier. She stomps her foot angrily. INDY flinches. She starts to grabs her. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, what do you think is going on here? Since I've met you, I've nearly been incinerated, drowned, shot at, and chopped into fish bait. We're caught in the middle of something sinister here. My guess is Dad found out more than he was looking for. And until I'm sure, I'm going to continue to do things the way I think they should be done.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He pulls her to him and kisses her. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you kiss me! Now ELSA reaches for INDY and kisses him. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. I don't like fast women. But he embraces her, and ELSA begins to nibble at his ear ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I hate arrogant men. INDY smiles slyly as they fall to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GONDOLIER SINGS as he steers his gondola carrying two p Indy's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY lies on top of ELSA, kissing her. He stops for a mom GONDOLIER SINGING. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, Venice. ELSA reaches up and pulls him back down to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mercedes-Benz glides through the sharp mountain curves. SUPERIMPOSED OVER A MAP that charts their course from Ven toward Salzburg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm clouds darken the skies. THUNDER EXPLODES in the distance; lightning flashes. The Mercedes-Benz drives int formidable stone castle. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about this place? ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the Brunwalds are famous art collectors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY reaches into the back seat and retrieves his bullwhi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. Think of something. He glances up to the beret ELSA is wearing. She reaches u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUTLER walks to the door and opens it to reveal INDY an outside in the rain. she now wears Indy's fedora; Indy is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? INDY, followed by ELSA, steps inside, shaking the water f adopts a Scottish accent. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And not before time! Did you intend to leave us standing on the doorstep all day? We're drenched! As INDY says this he pushes his way past the startled BUT handkerchief from the man's pocket. ELSA follows, taking SNEEZES HARD. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look! I've gone and caught a sniffle. INDY dabs at his nose with the handkerchief as ELSA looks amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly; with Austrian accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you expected? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take that tone with me, my good man. Now buttle off and tell Baron Brunwald that Lord Clarence MacDonald and his lovely assistant are here to view the tapestries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tapestries? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear me, the man is dense. This is a castle, isn't it? There are tapestries? BUTLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a castle. And we have many tapestries. But if you're a Scottish lord, then I am Mickey Mouse. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare he?! Simultaneously knocking the BUTLER cold with one slug on falls against a wall tapestry, sliding down to the floor,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY and ELSA move cautiously and quietly down the wide, APPROACHING VOICES ARE HEARD. Indy and Elsa creep past a NAZI SOLDIERS working around a large table with a map ato INDY reacts to the sight of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ELSA; softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nazis. I hate these guys. INDY and ELSA continue down the hallway. Indy carries a g his whip hangs from his belt. He steps to a closed door a INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one. I think he's in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know? INDY points out an ELECTRICAL WIRE. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's wired. He studies the situation for a moment, then decides to en doors. He knocks at the doorВ—there is no response. He lo enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark and empty. INDY throws open the window s out. RAIN comes down in sheets. There is a wide ledge ben but below that is a SHEER DROP. Indy wants to get out ont which is several yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy? Indy? INDY reassures her. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry... this is kid's play. I'll be right back. He leans out the window and wraps his bullwhip around som from the castle wall above the next window. He gives the whip a forceful tug to make certain it will

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY SWINGS from the window to the stone gargoyle.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDOW LEDGE
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF WOODEN SHUTTERS seals the window. INDY takes hold of the bullwhip with both hands, pushes o swings toward the shuttered window with his feet extended THROUGH THE WOODEN SHUTTERS as a CLAP OF THUNDER disguise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY CRASHES THROUGH SHUTTERS AND GLASS into the room. Th shutters hang by their hinges. Rain and cold air whip thr No sooner does Indy get to his feet, than a VASE COMES CR THE BACK OF HIS HEAD. Stunned, INDY sinks to one knee... and Indy's father, PRO steps out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior? INDY gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a reflex)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sirl

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This reply is a kneejerk reaction on Indy's part. Now the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is you Junior!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an old familiar irritation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me that, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to get you! What do you think?  NAZI VOICES ARE HEARD approaching. INDY and HENRY press t against the wall, Henry still holding the broken vase in INDY steps to the window and looks down. HENRY moves to a vase under the light for a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, mumbled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late Fourteenth Century, Ming Dynasty. HENRY is all about the broken vase which he still holds i son get onto crossed lines for a couple of moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it breaks the heart. INDY (quietly to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the head. (to HENRY, aggrievedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hit me, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the vase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never forgive myselfВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, misunderstanding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worryВ—I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HENRY has clearly been concentrating entirely on the vase broken end carefully. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it's fake. See, you can tell by the cross section. HENRY throws the vase against the wall where it SHATTERS. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Dad, get your stuff. We've got to get out of here. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I am sorry about your head, though. But I thought you were one of them. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, they come in through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good point. INDY steps to the door and stands, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But better safe than sorry. HENRY slides his umbrella through the straps of his bag. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HumpfВ—so I was wrong this time. But by God, I wasn't wrong when I mailed you my Diary. You obviously got it. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it and I used it. We found the entrance to the catacombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the library? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. And the tomb of Sir Richard?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INDY nods. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was actually there? You saw him? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what was left of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling with anticipation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his shield... the inscription on Sir Richard's shield...? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexandretta. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a great moment in HENRY's life. He turns aside, lost moment, then turns to INDY with joy. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexandretta... of course... on the pilgrim trail from the Eastern Empire. Oh, Junior... INDY winces, and would interrupt but suddenly it's not th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you did it. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dad. You did. Forty years. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only I could have been with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were rats, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. big ones. What do the Nazis want with you Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want my diary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? INDY's interest is a moment which becomes important later HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I had to get that book as far away from me as I possibly could. INDY's hand moves unconsciously to his pocket. His eyes t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. . . Then... BAMI The door is kicked open and three NAZIS ente OFFICER. The other two are SOLDIERS with machine guns. HE raise their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Jones!! HENRY & INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!! S.S. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will take the book now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to INDY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the Diary in your pocket. HENRY laughs genuinely, believing himself to be laughing S.S. OFFICER. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You doltl Do you think that my son would be that stupid that he would bring my Diary all the way back here? At which point an awful thought strikes HENRY. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't, did you? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't bring it, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, can we discuss this later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have mailed it to the Marx Brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take it easy....!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy?! Why do you think I sent it home in the first place? (points towards the NAZIS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it wouldn't fall into their hands!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came here to save you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? And who's gonna come to save you, Junior?? INDY's eyes blazes His nostrils flares He's so pissed off MACHINE GUN from the hands of one of the startled soldier we think he's going to use it on his dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you-- He turns and sprays the room with machine gun fire, cutti ribbons and blowing them backwards across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --don't call me Junior! HENRY looks shocked and horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what you did!! Indy grabs him and pushes him ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe what you just....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY leads HENRY down the hallway as he searches for Elsa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa? Elsa? He opens a door and enters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY and HENRY rush back into the room where ELSA had bee find: A Nazi COLONEL HOLDING ELSA HOSTAGE. His name is VOGEL: a vicious-looking, lantern jawed brute around Elsa's waist, the other hand presses the muzzle of ear. VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's far enough Put down the gun, Doctor Jones. Put down the gun or the Fraulein dies. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's one of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a Nazi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! INDY  is thrown. He doesn't know what to do. He looks at father. Everyone is yelling at once:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me! ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, no! VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will kill her! HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Go ahead! INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Don't Shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Indy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. He won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, please! Do what he says!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't listen to her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! She diesl VOGEL jams the barrel of the luger painfully into ELSA's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Waitl And then Indy gives in. He drops the machine gun to the t across, SHATTERING GLASS. HENRY GROANS audibly. VOGEL releases his grip on ELSA and shoves her toward IND directly into his arms. He holds her tightly. She buries

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. INDY comforts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't be. Her hand slips into his coat pocket and removes the Grail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you should have listened to your father. She steps back next to VOGEL. INDY is stunned. HENRY give withering look of reprimand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large baronial room decorated with ancient tapestries a FirelightВ—from the giant fireplaceВ—dances across the ce INDY and HENRY are ushered in, hands tied behind back, ac and ELSA and TWO NAZI GUARDS. ELSA crosses the room toward a high-backed chair facing t HENRY do not have the advantage of seeing who is sitting only see a HAND REACH OUT AND TAKE THE BOOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to HENRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ransacked her own room and I fell for it. How did you know she was a Nazi? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umh? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you she was a Nazi? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She talks in her sleep. INDY nods, and then the statement catches up with him. He with surprise. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't trust her. Why did you? MAN IN CHAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he didn't take my advice. The MAN IN THE CHAIR gets to his feet and turns, revealin WALTER DONOVAN. INDY and HENRY react with stunned express INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donovan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I warn you not to trust anybody, Doctor Jones? DONOVAN smiles benignly and flips through the Grail Diary HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I misjudged you WalterВ—I knew you'd sell your mother for an Etruscan vase. But I didn't know you'd sell your country and your soul to the slime of humanity. DONOVAN (suddenly erupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Schneider There're pages torn out of thisl ELSA rushes to DONOVAN's side. she takes the Grail Diary a look for herselfВ—then glances up at Indy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This book contained a mapВ—a map with no namesВ—precise directions from the unknown city to the secret Canyon of the Crescent Moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it did. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are these missing pages? This maps we must have these pages backs HENRY gives INDY a look of surprise. Indy smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Donovan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your breath. He won't tell us. And he doesn't have to... it's perfectly obvious where the pages are... (looking at Indy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he's given them to Marcus Brody. HENRY now wears a pained expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Indy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus?! You didn't drag poor Marcus along, did you? He's not up to the challenge. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks out like a sore thumb. We'll find him. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you will. He's got a two-day head-start on you, which is more than he needs. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody's got friends in every town and village from here to the Sudan. He speaks a dozen languages, knows every local custom. He'll blend in. Disappear. You'll never see him again. With any luck, he's got the Grail already. HENRY looks amazed and impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRODY disembarks from the train along with the other PASS section of ARABS and TUSKS. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone here speak English? Or even ancient Greek? A Man in the crowd holds out a cup of water to BRODY. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No water, no thank you. No, fish make love in it. BRODY continues through the crowd past various STREET VEN holds a chicken out to him. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much. No, I don't like that. No, I really don't want... No, no, thank you very much. No, thank you, madam. I'm a vegetarian. The Woman walks away, leaving BRODY alone in the crowd. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone understand a word I'm saying here? SALLAH shoulders his way through the mob toward BRODY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Brodyl They meet and hug, then begin to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Sallahl What a relief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus Brody, sir. And where is Indy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's in Austria. A slight detour. SALLAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are on your own? A Woman runs in and tugs on BRODY's coat. He waves her aw

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but don't panic. Everything's under control. Have you. . .have you arranged our supplies? SALLAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, of course. But where are we going? BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this map will show you. It was drawn by, uh... BRODY searches in his coat pocket for the map as a SINIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Brody? BRODY puts the map back in his pocket. The SINISTER MAN c bows quickly. SINISTER MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Iskenderun. The Director of the Museum of Antiquities has sent a car for you. BRODY takes off his hat. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what?... your servant, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I am his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me, please. The man turns and joins a SECOND MAN. BRODY and SALLAH fo BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My reputation precedes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no museum in Iskenderun. The SECOND MAN overhears SALLAH. He and his companion tur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papers please. SALLAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papers? (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SALLAH puts Brody's luggage down and glances at BRODY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run. BRODY does not run. SALLAH pats his clothing, searching f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papers, sir. Got it here. SALLAH laughs and pulls out a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just finished reading it myself. (laughs; then, to Brody)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! BRODY looks confused. SALLAH shows the newspaper to the S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SALLAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egyptian Mail. Morning edition. (to Brody)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say...? Uh, uh... SALLAH puts the newspaper in front of the SECOND MAN's fa him through the newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! The SECOND MAN falls, knocking over a vendor's stand. SAL begin to run. SALLAH knocks the FIRST MAN into another ve STAND COLLAPSES on impact. SALLAH grabs BRODY and pulls him through the crowded stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brody; pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, quick, quick, quickl Hide in that doorl Hide in that door! SALLAH points to a DARKENED DOORWAY, hung with a curtain, ramp. BRODY runs up the ramp, throws back the curtain and the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ThenВ—METAL DOORS ARE SLAMMED behind Brody and we realize actually run into the back of a Nazi TROOP TRUCK. SALLAH runs after the Truck until he reaches a wall, then dejectedly as the Truck drives away with BRODY inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark. Ancient, floor-length drapes cover the FIREPLACE that's nearly large enough for a man to stand u one wall. The NAZI GUARDS have tied INDY and HENRY back-to-back in ELSA and DONOVAN stand over them. VOGEL enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intolerable. VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Schneider. Message from Berlin. You must return immediately: a rally at the Institute of Aryan Culture. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your presence on the platform is requested... at the highest level. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Herr Oberst. (to DONOVAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will meet you at Iskenderun. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this Diary to the Reich Museum in Berlin. It will show them our progress, ahead of schedule. Without a map, I'm afraid it's no better than a souvenir. He hands her the Grail Diary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to DONOVAN, meaning Indy and Henry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me kill them now.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. If we fail to recover the pages from Brody, we'll need them alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to VOGEL, with a helpless shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always do what the doctor orders. DONOVAN leads VOGEL out. The NAZI GUARDS follow. Once the ELSA turns to INDY. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me like thatВ—we both wanted the Grail, I would have done anything to get it. You would have done the same. INDY shakes his head "no." INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you think so. She runs her hand down the side of his face. INDY pulls a INDY and HENRY are still tied back-to-back of course. ELS quietly into INDY's ear... which is near enough to Henry'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't forget... how wonderful it was. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. It was rather wonderful. She smiles and kisses INDY passionately. HENRY glances ba disappointed. VOGEL appears to remind ELSA of her appointment. VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Schneider! Your car is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to INDY, after finishing the kiss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how Austrians say goodbye. ELSA exits. VOGEL stays behind for another moment.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is how we say goodbye in Germany, Doctor Jones. VOGEL punches INDY in the jaw. A hard and vicious jab tha around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh. . . VOGEL exits. INDY shakes his head clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh... I like the Austrian way better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did I. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try and get these ropes loose. We've got to get to Marcus before the Nazis do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said he had two days' start. That he would blend in. Disappear! INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?В—I made that up! You know MarcusВ—he got lost once in his own museum! Indy and Henry are pulling at the ropes with great urgenc INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you try and reach into my left jacket pocket? HENRY is able to wiggle his hand towards Indy's coat pock body around towards Henry's hand. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lucky charm. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels like a cigarette lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try and burn through the ropes. HENRY's fingers open the lighter and ignite the flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. HENRY yelps as the cigarette lighter burns his hand. He d floor. Henry kicks at the lighter, trying to reach it, bu burn. INDY doesn't know it yet. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ought to tell you something. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get sentimental now DadВ— save it 'til we get out of here. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor's on fire! See?! INDY (turns and sees)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What??? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the chair. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, movel Move!  Rock your Chair.  Do what I do. They begin to rock their chair legs, inching their way of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as ELSA is driven away. VOGEL and DONOVAN remain behind, SOLDIERS . Another car pulls up and VOGEL holds the door open for DO the rear seat. A LIEUTENANT approaches with a written mes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Etwas wichtig, mein Herr. DONOVAN puts on his glasses to read the message. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we have Marcus Brody. But more important, we have the map. A RADIO OPERATOR steps forward with yet another written m DONOVAN.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RADIO OPERATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aus Berlin, mein Herr. DONOVAN (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "By the personal command of the Fuhrer. Secrecy essential to success. Eliminate the American conspirators." (to VOGEL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Germany has declared war on the Jones boys. (to DRIVER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Los fahren. The car drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY and HENRY are still in their chairs, tied back-to-ba communicate with Henry, but each time he calls him, the m opposite directions. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! Finally they turn their heads in the same direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head for the fireplace!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. BANGING, ROCKING and HOPPING their chairs, they work thei FIREPLACEВ—the only safe place from the now ROARING FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can get these ropes off. Indy struggles to free his hands. His foot kicks out and grill that operates a Secret Door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoopsl The fireplace floor rotates like a Lazy Susan and Indy an themselves in the:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where a NAZI RADIOMAN wearing headphones sits at an elabo switches and meters, and a WOMAN stands over a map plotti Their backs are turned to INDY and HENRY. The floor begins to rotate again, and INDY and HENRY find

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: inside the fireplace, still tied back-to-back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our situation has not improved. INDY glances over his shoulder at HENRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Dad... I'm almost free. INDY's foot hits the grill again... and the fireplace rot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR NAZI RADIOMEN and the WOMAN are still hard at work w coordinates. Suddenly the Woman looks up and spots HENRY screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarm! Now the RADIOMEN turn to see HENRY and INDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schnel!! TWO NAZIS draw their revolvers and FIRE SEVERAL SHOTS at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY and HENRY rotate into the room which is now an INFER drapes and furniture are all ablaze. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is intolerable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out, Dad! INDY finally breaks free. And he immediately begins to un

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All FOUR RADIOMEN now have their guns drawn. They activat begin to rotate through the Secret Door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RADIOMEN appear in the fireplace on the other sideВ—b OF INDY AND HENRY. The RADIOMEN move cautiously toward the flame, shielding hand, holding their guns with the other. Is it possible t escaped through these flames? Not a chance. They've hidden themselves UP THE CHIMNEY. And now they DR BEHIND the RADIOMEN. One of the RADIOMEN grabs INDY by the neck. As they strug the rotating wall and disappear into the next room, leavi behind. HENRY presses against the wall, which rotates again. As h next room, a DEAD NAZI RADIOMAN swivels into the room. Th rush forward to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY picks up a BUST OF HITLER and uses it to jam the rot sealing the NAZIS inside the burning room.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CASTLE HALLWAY- DAY
dialogues.text: Vogel strides purposefully down the hallway. He BARKS an MORE NAZIS fall into step with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY grabs his whip, his leather sack and Henry's case fr the case to HENRY and they begin to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY and HENRY step into an empty room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead end. HENRY looks horrified by what he's been forced to do as I frantically for an exit. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be a... a secret door around. A passageway or something. INDY begins to run his hands over the wallsВ—frantic. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find that if I just sit down and think... HENRY sits on a chair which tips back, hitting the wall b INDY's feet suddenly begins DROPPING AWAYI INDY grabs a railing to keep from falling, but loses his the opening which has formed a SPIRAL STAIRCASE. He rolls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the solution presents itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY follows INDY down the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stairway deposits Indy and Henry into an enormous WAT beneath the mountain on which the castle was built. A full-scale Nazi BOAT DOCK has been built inside the cav MOTORBOATS, GUNBOATS, SUPPLY BOATS, etc. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. More boats.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INDY boards one of the motorboats and STARTS THE MOTOR. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you say this has been just another typical day for you? Huh? HENRY tosses his case at INDY who catches it and angrily father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooofl No! It's been better than most. INDY moves back to the dock and pushes the boat away. HEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Dad. Come onl HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the boat? We're not going on the boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOGEL and the NAZI SOLDIERS enter the room and spot the s leading below. They quickly descend the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as VOGEL and the NAZI SOLDIERS rush to the dock. Vogel se is missing. He orders the Nazi Soldiers into a boat. VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sie alle ins Boat. Schnell! CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL a large box which suddenly BR as INDY, now on a motorbike with HENRY in the sidecar, RO DOCK, hitting TWO NAZI SOLDIERS who scream as they fall i VOGEL screams after INDY and HENRY as they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY looks pleased as he drives the motorbike along the r appears worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: FOUR NAZI SOLDIERS ON MOTORCYCLES
dialogues.text: They chase down the road after INDY and HENRY. INDY turns the motorbike down a smaller, dusty tree-lined as he is jostled about in the sidecar. One of the NAZI SO a higher road running in the same direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY approaches the barricade from one direction as one o approaches from a higher road. A GUARD steps from the road station and calls to the vehi HENRY SMASH THROUGH THE BARRICADE. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt! Halt! THE NAZI SOLDIER rides his motorcycle through the other s IT SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: INDY AND HENRY
dialogues.text: INDY grabs at a FLAGPOLE as they roar pastВ—it snaps off The NAZI SOLDIER drives his motorcycle toward INDY and HE unshoulders his machine gun. INDY uses the broken flagpole as a lance and knocks the N motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIDERLESS MOTORCYCLE
dialogues.text: drives on toward the other NAZI SOLDIERS now approaching COLLIDING WITH TWO OF THEM. The remaining NAZI SOLDIER maneuvers his motorcycle aroun comrades and continues the chase.

dialogues.speaker: INDY AND HENRY
dialogues.text: As the remaining NAZI SOLDIER rides alongside their motor preparing to fire. INDY quickly jams the remaining portion of the flagpole t Nazi's front wheel. The NAZI SOLDIER'S MOTORCYCLE FLIPS THREE TIMES, throwing the air.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INDY glances back and smiles, but the smile fades as he l see a sign at a CROSSROAD. Arrows pointing in opposite di way to BERLIN or VENEDIG. Indy starts down the road marked VENEDIG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! The motorbike skids to a stop. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going the wrong Way!  We have to get to Berlin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing towards Venedig)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody's this way. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Diary's in Berlin. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need the Diary, Dad. Marcus has the map. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is more in the Diary than just the map. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right DadВ—tell me. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he who finds the Grail must face the final challenge. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What final challenge? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three devices of such lethal cunning. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booby traps?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. But I found the clues that will safely take us through, in the Chronicles of St. Anselm. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what are they? Can't you remember? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wrote them down in my Diary so that I wouldn't have to remember INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half the German Army's on our tail and you want me to go to Berlin? Into the lion's den? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! The only thing that matters is the Grail. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Marcus? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus would agree with me. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two selfless martyrs. Jesus Christl HENRY slaps him across the face. INDY is rocked to his fo means entirely by the blow itself. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for blasphemy. The quest for the Grail is not archaeology. It's a race against evil. If it is captured by the Nazis, the armies of darkness will march all over the face of the earth. Do you understand me? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an obsession Dad. I never understood it. Never. Neither did Mom. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, she did. Only too well. Unfortunately she kept her illness from me until all I could do was mourn her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrows point in opposite directions to VENICE and BERLIN. IN on the portion of the sign reading BERLIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Nazi RallyВ—a book-burning is in process. The mound of burning books is ten feet tall and growing b Students and Nazi Brownshirts continually toss more books Flags, banners and standards displaying the swastika are from side to side in a motion that echoes the mounting fr crowd. INDY and HENRY walk toward the Square. Indy wears the uni Soldier. He is now buttoning up the tunicВ—which happens too big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boy, we are Pilgrims in an unholy land. Then... Indy sees something that makes him stop in his tr HIS LINE OF SIGHT to:

dialogues.speaker: THE PODIUM
dialogues.text: where high-ranking Officers of the Third Reich stand flan they oversee the rally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELSA is walking away in an open area, background of torch Officers... one of whom is now none other than INDY, comi knows he is there. His voice is quiet and tough, his eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fraulein Doctor. Where is it? Still startled, her reaction makes it clear that Indy is thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it? I want it. INDY pushes ELSA against a column and begins to search he Diary. He pulls the book from Elsa's pocket.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back for the book? Whv? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father didn't want it incinerated. She understands him. It's as though he slapped her. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you think of me? I believe in the Grail, not the Swastika.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet you stood up to be counted with the enemy of everything the Grail stands forВ—who gives a damn what you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard and fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do. Now it's as though she'd slapped him back. His hands fly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I have to do is squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I have to do is scream. It's a standoff emotionally. He knows he'd never do it. s the same goes for screaming. INDY releases her and backs away. she looks at him with a moves over to HENRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it. Let's get the hell out of here. They move off and almost run headlong into HITLER and his coming down from the Podium. 50 kids push their autograph signature. HITLER pauses to sign them. Hitler looks Indy's way. They only lasts a moment but the moment is electric. HITLER breaks the spell by taking the Grail Diary from hi page and signs his autograph. He hands it back and moves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy's motorcycle pulls up to the main terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Plainclothes Agent distributes leaflets bearing HENRY'S Soldiers inside the terminal. HENRY leans in a doorway reading a newspaper as INDY ente and taps Henry's shoulder. They begin to walk toward the boarding gates. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you get? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. The first available flight out of Germany. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. INDY and HENRY show their papers to the Boarding Guards, passengers, which has already begun to move toward a:

dialogues.speaker: MOORED ZEPPELIN
dialogues.text: Ten stories tall and longer than two football fields: Fly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Zeppelin is about to take off. INDY and HENRY make th in one of the compartments. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we made it. HENRY looks over his newspaper at INDY. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we're airborne, with Germany behind us, then I'll share that sentiment. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. But INDY looks out the window and is suddenly concerned w

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL AND A GESTAPO AGENT
dialogues.text: rushing across the tarmac toward the Zeppelin. VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicht zumachen! Wir steigen ein!

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: sits back in his chair, looks to HENRY, now reading his n A STEWARD enters and sets a bowl of nuts on the table in HENRY, then continues down the aisle of passengers. Indy Steward. He puts his arm around the Steward's shoulder an up a flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: now walks up the aisle. He approaches a MALE PASSENGER hi newspaper. VOGEL uses his walking stick to lower the news Passenger the leaflet with Henry's photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haben sie disen Mann gesehen? The Passengers at the table shake their heads in the nega picture to other Passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fahrscheine, bitte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nein. VOGEL turns to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich habe ihn night gesehen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tickets please. The Passengers do not react to the request, made in Engli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fahrscheine meine Dame. Bitte.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: approaches HENRY, still hidden behind his newspaper. Agai walking stick to lower the paper, revealing Henry's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten Tag, Herr Jones. Now INDY, still playing the role of Steward, asks VOGEL f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fahrscheine meine Herr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tickets please. HENRY looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in German)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was? VOGEL glances up and recognizes INDYВ—who quickly punches knocking him toward the window. In another quick move, In THE WINDOW onto the tarmac below. Shocked Passengers blink in bewilderment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in German; with a shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ticket. Everyone else with a ticket quickly produces it and waves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOGEL gets to his knees as the huge Zeppelin rises into t revealing an airplane attached to the belly of the airshi the rising Zeppelin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du wirst nochmal boren von mir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY and HENRY together again in their compartment. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, sharing your adventures is an interesting experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning ELSA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not all we shared. It's disgraceful. You're old enough to be her fa---er, her grandfather! HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm as human as the next man. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was the next man. HENRY (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ships that pass in the night... HENRY opens his Diary and begins to thumb through it. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember the last time we had a quiet drink? I had a milk shake. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm... What did we talk about? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't talk. We never talked. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do I detect a rebuke? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A regret. It was just the two of us, Dad. It was a lonely way to grow up. For you, too. If you had been an ordinary, average father like the other guys' dads, you'd have understood that. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was a wonderful father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? HENRY looks up from his Diary. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ever tell you to eat up? Go to bed? Wash your ears? Do your homework? No. I respected your privacy and I taught you self- reliance.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you taught me was that I was less important to you than people who had been dead for five hundred years in another country. And I learned it so well that we've hardly spoken for twenty years. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left just when you were becoming interesting. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, how can you --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. I'm here now. He closes the Diary and leans back in his seat. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to talk about? Hmmm? INDY stutters uncomfortably as HENRY stares at him, waiti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I can't think of anything. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are you complaining about? (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we have work to do. When we get to Alexandretta we will face three challenges. (he reads from the Diary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "First, the breath of God. Only the penitent man will pass. Second, the Word of God, only in the footsteps of God will he proceed. Third, the Path of God, only in the leap from the lion's head will he prove his worth. " INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sunlight falls across the table from the window. INDY rea bar of sunlight turns like the hand of a clock over the t We see INDY puzzled. Only for a moment. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're turning around. They're taking us back to Germany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY and his father emerge from the hatchway into the bel The Zeppelin's elaborate metal framework is exposed. INDY and HENRY hurry down the catwalk until arriving at a DOORWAYS framed into the Zeppelin's outer skin. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I thought it would take them a lot longer to figure out the radio was dead. Come on, Dad. Move! Then INDY opens the doors. We see plenty of blue sky and see a small BIPLANE that is suspended from the Zeppelin b DEVICE. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Dad. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane as HENRY take seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with delight)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you could fly a plane. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fly--yes. Land--no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY turns in his seat to give HENRY the "thumbs up." Hen and points down to the ground. Then they both become aware of a STRANGE SOUND in the ski Something between a ROAR and a WAIL.

dialogues.speaker: TWO MESSERSCHMIDT FIGHTER BOMBERS
dialogues.text: streak out of the clouds and race across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: INDY AND HENRY
dialogues.text: shrink in their seats as the MESSERSCHMIDTS (going three are) SCREAM past on either side. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, you're gonna have to use the machine gun. Get it ready. HENRY turns and grips the MOUNTED MACHINE GUN with a perp expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning; pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven o'clock! HENRY pulls out his watch. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DadВ—eleven o'clock!! HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens at eleven o'clock? INDY uses his arm to demonstrate that he's referring to a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TwelveВ—elevenВ—ten. Eleven o'clock. Fire! HENRY doesВ—and the EXPLODING GUN nearly shakes him out o Indy's slow speed and small size works to his advantage. Messerschmidts continually overshoot him, WHIZZING past i wide turns miles away in the sky. HENRY has one of the Messerschmidts in his sight. He pull

dialogues.speaker: --RATTA-A-TAT-TAT
dialogues.text: The Messerschmidt banks to the left, but HENRY keeps it i swings the gun around, inadvertently CUTTING HIS OWN REAR HALF. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, are we hit?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More or less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, I'm sorry. They got us. INDY looks back at the missing tail section, then at his The plane begins to go down. INDY struggles to control it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Dads We're going in! HENRY slumps down fearfully in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheels of the plane touch down. OUT OF CONTROL, the P CRASHES first into a corral of goats and then into the fa a cloud of dust into the air. As INDY pulls himself from the cockpit:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Suddenly, INDY's attention is directed to:

dialogues.speaker: TWO SCREAMING MESSERSCHMIDTS
dialogues.text: coming in low. Guns BLAZING. As BULLETS EXPLODE around them, INDY and HENRY jump over barricade. Henry, frightened, grabs at Indy. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those people are trying to kill us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Dadl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a new experience for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens to me all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLD MAN kneels at his car repairing a rear tire.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: turns to the wheel, the hubcap in his hands. Suddenly the startling the Old Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY has the throttle down, both hands tightly gripping t HENRY is a very nervous passenger. INDY sees a LOW-FLYING MESSERSCHMIDT coming up behind him MIRROR. As the Messerschmidt ROARS by overhead, BULLETS EXPLODE a narrowly missing the car. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is intolerable! INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be close.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The car races toward a TUNNEL that cuts through a steep M The Messerschmidt bears down on Indy's car, machine guns The car ENTERS the tunnel. The Messerschmidt cannot pull SLAMS into the MOUTH OF THE TUNNEL, SHEARING OFF its WING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FLAMING FUSELAGE continues to ROCKET through the tunn down the muzzle of a gun. SPARKS fly as its belly SCRAPES pavement and the sides of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy and Henry look over their shoulders to see this wing gaining on them; about to overtake them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster, boy --faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car exits the tunnel at top speed and veers off the road. The flaming Messerschmidt fuselage shoots past and EXPLODES in the middle of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car emerges safely from the flames, Henry wipes th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they don't come any closer than that! HENRY looks out the windshield and sees the second Messer out of the sky toward them.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The MESSERSCHMIDT drops its single UNDER-FUSELAGE BOMB. I the road directly ahead of the car, missing it by only se

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: FALLS INTO THE HOLE made by the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY climbs out of the car, still in the bomb crater. He INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, he's coming back. INDY and HENRY run down the mountainside to:

dialogues.speaker: A DESERTED MEDITERRANEAN BEACH
dialogues.text: INDY and HENRY run to the shoreline. Indy reaches for his pants. He opens the chamberВ—the GUN HAS NO BULLETS.

dialogues.speaker: THE MESSERSCHMIDT
dialogues.text: swings around and is coming in for another pass.

dialogues.speaker: INDY AND HENRY
dialogues.text: exchange a wordless glance. They don't even think about r place to run to. HENRY hands his case to INDY. Holding his umbrella, HENRY suddenly spins around and run shouting into A FLOCK OF SEA GULLS... THE SEA GULLS take to the wing in flight. Thousands of th

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Bullets kick up sand leading up to him... thenВ— THE MESSERSCHMIDT AND THE SEA GULLS meet in midair. MASSA gulls are shredded by the Messerschmidt's whirling propel FEATHERY WHITE PUREE that SPLATTERS against the cockpit a ENGINE. ENGINE SPUTTERS... STALLS... Silence. The Messerschmidt f and EXPLODES in an OFF CAMERA SOUND EFFECT. INDY stands as beforeВ—stunnedВ—a statue. HENRY walks back to INDY. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suddenly remembered Charlemagne. "Let my armies be the rocks and the trees and the birds in the sky." (he chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY wears a proud expression as he watches HENRY walk do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SULTAN is seated in his royal chair, flanked by WALTE VOGEL and surrounded by his minions. DONOVAN holds the missing Grail Diary pages. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These pages are taken from Professor Jones' diary, Your Highness. And they include a map that pinpoints the exact location of the Grail. DONOVAN and the SULTAN walk together through an archway. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can see, the Grail is all but in our hands. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, Your Highness, we would not think of crossing your soil without your permission, nor of removing the Grail from your borders without suitable compensation.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SULTAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you brought? VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring den Schatzl TWO NAZI SOLDIERS bring forward a HUGE STEAMER TRUNK. The and begin to empty it of its contents: Gold and silver objects of every description. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious valuables, Your Highness, "donated" by some of the finest families in all of Germany. The SULTAN gets up from his chair and walks toward the tr past it and begins to inspect the Nazi staff car parked n SULTAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolls-Royce Phantom Two. 4.3 litre, 30 horsepower, six cylinder engine, with Stromberg Downdraft carburetor. The SULTAN points to the engine under the hood. SULTAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can go from zero to 100 kilometres an hour in 12.5 seconds. And I even like the color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The keys are in the ignition, Your Highness. SULTAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shall have camels, horses, an armed escort, provisions, desert vehiclesВ—and tanksl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. Somebody else is also taking note...and we see that it is court. ELSA is revealed coming down the stairs toward DONOVAN an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no time to lose. Indiana Jones and his father have escaped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLAH drives his car through the crowded streets, INDY b in the back seat. SALLAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go this way. SALLAH waves his arms and shouts to a CAMEL HERDER. SALLAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that camel out of the way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Marcus, Sallah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, they set out across the desert this afternoon. I believe they took Mister Brody with them. HENRY removes his hat and hits INDY with it. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they have the map! And in this sort of race, there's no silver medal for finishing second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa and Donovan's partyВ—consisting of a SUPPLY TRUCK, O

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS RIDING CAMELS, SPARE HORSES AND A TANK AND VARIO
dialogues.text: VEHICLESВ—all moving along through the ramble of this box ELSA, DONOVAN and VOGEL travel in the open car. The TANK War I model with enormous treads. The Turkish soldiers we carry both carbines and sabers. BRODY sits alongside ELSA in the rear of the car carrying hands a canteen back to him. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care to wet your whistle, Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather spit in your face. But as I haven't got any spit... VOGEL snatches the canteen away from BRODY before he can VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must be within three or four miles. Otherwise we are off the map.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He hands the map to ELSA, drinks from the canteen, and ha DONOVAN. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Marcus, we are on the brink of the recovery of the greatest artifact in the history of mankind. BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're meddling with powers you cannot possibly comprehend. HENRY and SALLAH are at INDY's side as he views Donovan's distance. Parked nearby is a CAR containing all of their INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I see Brody. He seems okay. They've got a tank. Six-pound gun. Then Donovan notices a reflection from the hills. What he sees is:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing?! Get down! INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, we're well out of range. At that moment the tank FIRES A SHELL in their direction. It WHISTLES overhead and BLOWS UP THE PARKED CAR. INDY, H SALLAH cover their heads as automobile fragments rain dow SALLAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That car belonged to my brother- in-law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on--come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see anyone up there.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it wasn't even Jones. ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's him all right. He's here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to VOGEL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put Brody in the tank. KAZIM peers over a rock, pointing his rifle at the group

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ELSA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in this sun, without transportation, they're as good as dead. BULLETS EXPLODE off the vehicles and cliff. DONOVAN and E A NAZI SOLDIER falls from the tank as BULLETS EXPLODE aro KAZIM'S MEN, BRETHREN OF THE CRUCIFORM SWORD, continue to and DONOVAN take cover beside the parked car. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jones, all right.

dialogues.speaker: INDY'S GROUP
dialogues.text: INDY and HENRY, followed by SALLAH, take cover behind a r Kazim's Men and the Nazi Troops exchanging fire below the HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, who are all these people? INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares? As long as they're keeping Donovan busy. Dad, you stay here while Sallah and I organize some transportation. CUT BACK to the action. The BRETHREN are firing at the DONOVAN party and are being fired on by the Donovan party TWO NAZI SOLDIERS throw HAND GRENADES into the cliffs. Th killing one of Kazim's Brethren. The battle continuesВ—a fierce exchange of GUNSHOTS, GREN MACHINE GUN FIRE with losses on both sides.

dialogues.speaker: INDY AND SALLAH
dialogues.text: crouch behind a rock watching as men on both sides of the camels and horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going after those horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the camels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need camels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, IndyВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No camels!

dialogues.speaker: DONOVAN AND ELSA
dialogues.text: They look down at KAZIM who lies mortally wounded on the ELSA looks saddened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re KAZIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he? KAZIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A messenger from God. For the unrighteous, the Cup of Life holds everlasting damnation. KAZIM dies.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: leaps atop a TURKISH SOLDIER on horseback, pulling the ma the ground. A SECOND TURK comes to assist his comrade; IN horse, knocking both Turks to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRODY has been left alone in the tank. HENRY climbs down taps Brody on the shoulder, startling him. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus! BRODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arghhh! Oh!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They exchange an old University Club toast, swinging thei and missing. Then HENRY flaps his arms and tugs his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Genius of the RestorationВ—" Now BRODY tugs his ears, flaps his arms and touches his h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "В—aid our own resuscitation!" They exchange a handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henryl What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rescue, old boys Come on. As HENRY starts to climb out of the tank, TWO NAZI SOLDIE above, their Lugers drawn. They are followed by VOGEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re HENRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search him. The NAZI SOLDIERS point their guns at HENRY and BRODY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to HENRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

SPARKS FLY; the AGAINST THE WINDOW and RICOCHETS ONCE MORE, this time pas THE TANK DRIVER'S HAT. Blood flows from under the hat as slumps forward, his body depressing the levers.

As HENRY speeds toward the front of the tank to certain d lightning speed, whips out his bullwhip, wrapping the end Henry's right ankle.

dialogues.text: Oh, God. I've lost him. And I never told him anything. I just wasn't ready, Marcus. Five minutes would have been enough. And then... looking dazed and bewildered, INDY STAGGERS U He joins the others at the edge of the cliff, looking dow with a bewildered expression. Finally, Henry becomes aware of his presence. HENRY says nothing. He just looks at Indy, overcome with throws his arms around him.

dialogues.text: I thought I'd lost you, boy. After a moment, Indy's head clears. And he becomes aware embrace. Something he hasn't felt in a long timeВ—if ever He hugs his father back. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WellВ—well done! Come on! HENRY pats INDY on the back and Indy collapses, sitting h edge.

dialogues.text: Step back now, Doctor Schneider. Give Doctor Jones some room. He's going to recover the Grail for us.

dialogues.text: INDY laughs. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible? What do you say, Jones? Ready to go down in history?

dialogues.text: As what? A Nazi stooge like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scornfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nazis?!В—Is that the limit of your vision?! The Nazis want to write themselves into the Grail legend and take on the world. Well, they're welcome. But I want the Grail itself. The cup that gives everlasting life. Hitler can have the world, but he can't take it with him. I'm going to be drinking my own health when he's gone the way of the Dodo. (he draws his pistol)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grail is mine, and you're going to get it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting me won't get you anywhere. DONOVAN

dialogues.text: Dad?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

The two decapitated men lie him. He walks to the entranceway, flanked by two stone li reaction shotsВ—ELSAВ—SALLAHВ—BRODYВ—DONOVANВ—registering different emotions INDY proceeds forward. His hands open the Grail Diary. INDY

dialogues.text: "The Breath of God... Only the penitent man will pass. Only the penitent man will pass. . . " INDY takes a few steps forward. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Only the penitent man will pass. Only the penitent man will pass."

dialogues.text: (quietly to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penitent man. The penitent... INDY takes a step forward through the cobwebs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penitent man is humble before God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penitent. Penitent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penitent man is humble... The cobwebs begin to move....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kneels before God. (to himself; suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kneel!! We hear the awful rush of airВ—WHOOSH! Because INDY is in kneeling, only his hat is knocked off and his hair flies Instinctively he ROLLS FORWARD on the ground out of harm' From his new position he is able to see what is causing a SHARP TRIPLE PENDULUM. INDY gets cautiously to his feet. Now he sees the pendulu SMALL CORRIDOR which turns a corner to the left fifty yar wheels turnВ—the mechanism controlling the spinning blade around the wheels, jamming the mechanism and stopping the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm through!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're through! BRODY and SALLAH smile, relieved.

dialogues.text: (to HENRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all right. HENRY shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO INDY
dialogues.text: holding the Grail Diary, reading once again, his fedora n

dialogues.text: "The second challenge is the Word of God. Only in the footsteps of God will he proceed." (to himself)

dialogues.text: lifts his head painfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Word of God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Henry. Try not to talk.

dialogues.text: The Name of God...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO INDY
dialogues.text: as he studies the cobblestones before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Name of God... Jehovahl

dialogues.text: still lies in SALLAH's arms. BRODY leans over him.
