dialogues.speaker: "J."
dialogues.text: INDY takes a step and immediately a stone breaks away and hip -- his leg stuck through the hold where the stone onc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO INDY
dialogues.text: who grunts as he pulls himself from the hole, the v-rail INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Latin, "Jehovah" starts with an "I." "I"... Now we SEE each letter on the stones as INDY carefully wa DONOVAN and ELSA follow in his footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: "E"... "H"... "O"... "V"... "A"...
dialogues.text: INDY sighs with relief and steps forward to:

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT ABYSS
dialogues.text: INDY stands in a small opening, just small enough for his through and beyond that a 100 foot drop to the rocks belo nothing but a rough, stony cliff wall.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO INDY
dialogues.text: He can see nowhere to cross. He looks again to the v-rail INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The path of flood. Only in the leap from the lion's head will he prove his worth." INDY looks around and then he notices that inscribed into the rock above his head is the head of a lion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossiblel Nobody can jump this! INDY looks down into the Diary and tortures over what it is asking him to do.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: rushes forward and calls to INDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy... Indy, you must hurry!! Come quickly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... a leap of faith. Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: calls to his son. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must believe, boy. you must... believe. We see him do it. We see him leap into space. We see that see that he is not going to make it. His hands claw for t going to fall 100 feet to his death. And thenВ—he doesn't up by thin air as he lands on his hands and knees. INDY looks around and down and now he figures it out. Ingeniously, the First Crusaders have painted a pathway t 100 feet below. It is a perfect forced perspective image lines from a hundred feet continuing six feet below his s are stepping. It's painted to blend in with the rocks below. Highly evo perfect alignment with everything we see below. When INDY leans out to the left or right... that's when h alignment shift that betrays the trick. Indy throws some he crosses it like the first Crusader from the painting o Indy crawls through a small opening in the side of the cl A vast array of chalices is displayed on the altar of thi hundred or more. Many sizes, many shapes, some gold, some glitter and shine. INDY is mesmerized by their number and their beauty. And a man is praying at the altarl He has his back turned to INDY... but he is dressed as wh KNIGHT.

dialogues.text: But we can't see the Grail Knight's face. The visor of hi Perhaps we see his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: When the GRAIL KNIGHT sees INDY he gets wearily to his fe prepares to give combat...taking up his two-handed broads Indy, attempting to swing the huge, heavy sword but findi much. Indy dodges two or three clumsy swings of the sword to fight back...until the Knight, exhausted, drops the sw approaches him and raises the visor and we see that the K man. KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come, but my strength has left me. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of three brothers who swore an oath to find the Grail and to guard it. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was seven hundred years ago. KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time to wait. The GRAIL KNIGHT reaches forward and fingers Indy's cloth KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're strangely dressed...for a knight. INDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not exactly...a knight. What do you mean? KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was chosen because I was the bravest and the most worthy. The honor was mine until another came to challenge me to single combat. I pass it to you who vanquished me. The GRAIL KNIGHT holds his sword out to INDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gulp)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I don't have time to explain, butВ— At that moment DONOVAN and ELSA appear. Donovan turns to of cups. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is it?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must choose. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But choose wisely. For as the True Grail will bring you lifeВ— the False Grail will take it from you. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a historian. I have no idea what it looks like. Which one is it? ELSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me choose. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Doctor. ELSA and INDY exchange looks. He thinks he is seeing her ELSA chooses a cupВ—a solid gold, emerald encrusted goble DONOVAN instantly takes it from her. DONOVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. It's more beautiful than I'd ever imagined. This certainly is the cup of the King of Kings. DONOVAN rushes to the well and fills the goblet with wate

dialogues.text: What . . . is . . . happening. . . to . . . me. . .? He starts to ageВ—fast! His hair grows long and gray and Fingernails curl back on themselves. Milky cataracts coat ELSA gasps and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. . . is . . . happening. . . ? His skin turns brown and leathery and stretches across hi His skeletal hands reach for ELSA's throat, choking her.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INDY rushes forward and pushes DONOVAN away. As he falls INTO FLAMES, then SHATTERS AGAINST THE WALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would not be made out of gold. INDY picks up another cupВ—a simple earthenware jug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the cup of a carpenter. He and ELSA exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one way to find out. INDY goes to the well and fills the earthenware jug with INDY brings the jug to his lips and takes several large s A strange sensation overcomes him, a feeling of peace and see his wounds begin to heal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have chosen wisely. But the Grail cannot pass beyond the Great Seal. That is the boundary and the price of immortality.

dialogues.text: CUT TO BRODY AND SALLAH who attend to Henry awaiting Indy INDY and ELSA come forward with the Grail. HENRY swallows some of the water. Much of it runs down th mouth. Finally INDY pours the water over the wound and ev astonishment as the wound and the blood stain disappear b color returns to Henry's face. HENRY's eyes open. The first thing he sees is the Grail a they shift to INDY's faceВ—and they light up even more...

dialogues.text: run forward. SALLAH points a rifle at them.

dialogues.text: Drop your guns. Please. The NAZI SOLDIERS drop their weapons at their feet and ra surrender.

dialogues.text: (to HENRY)

dialogues.text: Dad, come on. Get to your feet.

dialogues.text: steps forward and picks up the Grail. She turns to INDY, possession of the Grail.

dialogues.text: Elsa! Elsa, don't movel

dialogues.text: Elsa, don't cross the Seal. The Knight warned us not to take the Grail from here. A RUMBLING SOUND IS HEARD and the ground roars and shifts the ceiling of the cavern. ELSA falls on the Great Seal. from her grasp. She reaches for it and the ground beneath OPEN. ELSA slips into the crevasse. She screams. ELSA is hanging perilously in the abyss, with the Grail a As her hands lose their grip, INDY just manages to one of sliding forward across the slanted floor.

dialogues.text: Junior!  Junior! With her free hand, ELSA is trying to get the Grail. INDY she gives him her free hand. She has to choose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa. Elsa don't. Elsa. Elsa. Give me your other hand, honey. I can't hold you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can reach it. I can reach it... Her hand begins to slip from Indy's grasp. INDY

dialogues.text: Elsa! Give me your hand. Give me your other hand! ELSA just manages to touch the Grail. In doing so, she ha farВ—INDY slides down another yard, Elsa loses her grip a her death.

dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: ... let it go... INDY abandons the Grail and grabs onto HENRY with both ha HENRY pulls him up to safety.

dialogues.text: looks through the falling debris to INDY and HENRY. SALLA from the crumbling Temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDY, HENRY, SALLAH and BRODY emerge from the Mountain Te the Grecian Facade. From within the Mountain Temple, the ROAR OF WALLS CAVING cloud of dust and smoke billows out from the entrance. HENRY turns to INDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa never really believed in the Grail. She thought she'd found a prize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did vou find, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?... Illumination. HENRY and INDY mount their horses. Henry turns back to hi

dialogues.text: Junior?! Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...What does it always mean, this...this "Junior?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his name. Henry Jones, Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May we go home now, please?
